title: Wescott & Hort Translation
description: The New Testament in the Original Greek is a Greek-language version of the New Testament published in 1881. It is also known as the Westcott and Hort text, after its editors Brooke Foss Westcott (1825–1901) and Fenton John Anthony Hort (1828–1892). Textual scholars use the abbreviations "WH" or "WHNU". It is a critical text, compiled from some of the oldest New Testament fragments and texts that had been discovered at the time.

pod.description:
This Bible is in the Public Domain and is produced at cost by the Digital Bible Society (dbs.org).

This Bible, and many others, are available for free download in a variety of digital formats at dbs.org/bibles.
